Transcript:
Lorelei: You know, there's good stuff about 
this life and there's bad stuff... Beth's life, I mean. Like, the good stuff 
is... Well, dinner tonight-- was that food scrumptious or what? (Laughs)

Edmund: Finger-licking good, which I half 
expected you to demonstrate the way you were salivating over it.

Lorelei: And the china and the silver and the 
crystal. Mmm... It was all so fancy. It was kind of like being royalty.
Edmund: No, royalty is far better, trust me.

Lorelei: Oh, that's right. 'Cause you are 
royalty... Or were. (Laughs) got to laugh at yourself, Eddie. Hey, so, was your 
palace as big as this mansion?

Edmund: This mansion is barely the size of my 
pool house.

Lorelei: Beth must have been pretty special, 
huh? I mean, people sure seem to love her a lot.

Edmund: There was a great deal about her to 
love.

Lorelei: Well, even though she was kind of 
uptight and boring?

Edmund: Beth was a lady. For example, she 
knew which fork to use for salad, a skill you have yet to master.

Lorelei: So, I used the wrong fork, so what? 
They didn't notice. They're just so happy to have me alive. I could eat with my 
feet and they wouldn't care.

Edmund: There are only but so many times that 
you have to slip up before we're caught. That's why we must keep drilling you. 
In fact, I think we should go upstairs right now and do it on your etiquette 
books.

Lorelei: Why are you so hard on me, huh? P's 
not hard on me. Yeah, Phillip, that's right, Phillip, my charming, refined, 
sexy, rich husband. Phillip adores me.
Edmund: Ex-husband, darling.

Lorelei: Not the way he was looking at me 
tonight, darling.

Edmund: I am your husband, Lorelei, as much 
as that frightens me, and you are my beloved Beth, my princess. You are 
completely devoted to me and that is the way you must think or this plan of ours 
won't work out.

Lorelei: See, that's funny, cause my mind's 
thinking in a different direction. I’m figuring I’m sitting here in hog heaven. 
Everybody thinks I’m Beth. I’m in, I did it. So remind me again: Why do I need 
you?
Romeo: You sure know how to throw one heck of a party, Tony.
Tony: Catalina planned it.

Romeo: Well, either way, you're still "da 
bomb."
Tony: Yeah. I’m "da bomb," all right...

Romeo: You are. Hey, you handled that Sam 
Spencer situation with total finesse. Marah thinks I’m the one who exposed 
Chavez and saved her dad, not Sam. And she's so mad at that guy; I don't think 
she'll ever speak to him again. And we got rid of him just like Carlos wanted us 
to, without having to use this.

Tony: You know what you just said? That was 
the best thing that came out of tonight.

Romeo: Not true, my friend. Now that Sam's 
out of the picture...

Tony: You know what? Don't, Romeo. I know 
where you're going, don’t.
Romeo: But now that Sam's gone...

Tony: Look, Romeo, Romeo, Romeo, put a lid on 
it, all right? You think... You think I jumped through hoops? You think I went 
through hell just so that Marah could come back to me?
Romeo: Yep.
Marah: (Sobbing) Go away! I mean it, Sam-- go away!
Sam: I feel terrible.

Marah: You should. You lied to me. Said you 
were responsible for clearing my dad when it was Tony all along.

Marah: Maybe if you had told the truth from 
the beginning, you wouldn't have lost me.

Sam: Marah, I don't believe that you think 
that's true any more than I do. At the party, after I told you it was Tony, I 
saw the way you looked at him. If he had given you just the smallest amount of 
encouragement, you would have run to his side in a heartbeat.
Marah: But he didn't, did he?

Sam: And that's what really bothers you. Not 
so much that I let you down, but that Tony...

Marah: No. No, that bothers me. That bothers 
me, big time. I was going to give myself to you tonight. I was going to be with 
you in a way that I’ve never been with anybody else. And you betrayed me. I feel 
sick.

Sam: One part of you does, yes. And I’m 
responsible for that sick feeling, and I will never forgive myself for that, but 
there is another part of you-- a bigger part-- that's thinking, "how could Tony 
do something like this for me, and then turn his back on me?" It's because he 
still loves you. But he just can't admit it. And, Marah, I know... I know you 
still love him, too. I saw the way the two of you danced together. It killed me. 
It killed Catalina, too. You want to know why it killed me so bad? Because I 
knew right then in that moment-- finally, I got it through my thick skull-- that 
I can't compete with that. No one can compete with that. Sure, I could 
manipulate you a thousand ways into loving me, but in the end it doesn't make a 
damn bit of difference. And you know what?
Marah: What?

Sam: I know you may hate me for lying to you, 
but I swear I hate myself even more, because that's not who I am. I’m not the 
kind of person that tricks someone into loving them. You either love me or you 
don't, and you don’t. And that's okay. But you should be with the person that 
you do love. You should go be with that person. You should go find Tony tonight. 
You should go make things right with him. He's the one you should have been with 
all along.

Tony: You think... You think I did all of this tonight just so that Marah would 
come back to me?

Romeo: Marah's no dummy, Tony. At some point 
she's going to wonder why me-- me of all people came to her rescue.

Tony: I told you to tell her it was business. 
You meathead.

Romeo: Yeah, and who do I work for? You. 
You're just now realizing this?

Tony: No. No, I’m cool, all right? Sam is the 
only one. The only other one that knew that I fixed that photo. And he would 
never point Marah in that direction. Never. What?

Romeo: There are a million ways you could've 
handled this Sam situation, but you chose the one way-- the one way-- that might 
bring Marah back to you. Open your eyes, man. You've got it so bad for this 
chick it's like a disease.

Tony: Would you go pay the stupid caterer? 
Go! Get the hell out of here! Go!

Buzz: I mean, can you believe Harley? She has one kid in the car, one kid in 
jail. Zach's the one that had the sense to be born in the hospital. Blake and 
Clarissa, you know?
Holly: In a cabin in the middle of a storm.

Buzz: What about Ross and Blake? I mean, you 
know, they were supposed to tie the knot. It was supposed to be a surprise 
party. He was going to propose, what happened?
Holly: Yeah. Yeah, I remember.
Buzz: What? It fizzled out?

Holly: He got busy with Danny’s trial and now 
he's teaching at the university.

Buzz: Well, that's why he's got an assistant, 
so he can spend time with Blake and the kids, right?
Holly: Yeah. That's what I thought.
Buzz: Well, this... What, Tory?
Holly: Mm-hmm.
Buzz: She's a help, right?

Holly: Oh, yeah, she's a lot of help. She's 
probably too much help.
Buzz: Meaning?
Holly: Meaning she has a "thing" for Ross.
Buzz: A "thing"?
Holly: Oh, yeah.
Buzz: Like... Like, like a father fixation?

Holly: "Like... Like," she admires him and 
she tells him how profound and how brilliant and how witty he is-- and on and on 
and on.

Buzz: Will she work for me? Oh, you are 
concerned.

Holly: I think Ross is at a stage in his life 
where he could be vulnerable to her charms.

Buzz: What charms? She's no competition for 
Blake, come on! I mean, she’s... Ross adores... He worships... She's the center 
of the... Enough with the kids. Come on. Let's dance.

Holly: Oh, I thought you'd never ask me 
again.

Buzz: This is going to be nice. I know this 
is going to be nicer.
Rick: Hey, grandpa Buzz.

Harley: Hi. The baby wouldn't sleep-- do you 
mind if we barge in?
Edmund: There is so much you still don't know about Beth it's frightening.

Lorelei: Yeah, well, whatever's left I can 
wing it.

Edmund: No. You can't wing names you've never 
heard, nor faces you've never seen, or facts. For example, Rick Bauer. Hmm? Your 
chum since high school? What's his father's name, and where is his father right 
now?

Lorelei: Well, that's not fair, you never 
told me that.

Edmund: Yes, well, try using that one on 
Rick. I’m sure he'd get a kick out of it, and there's one other thing you can't 
wing, darling-- Beth's innate sophistication, her grace and her style. You may 
have changed your hair and make-up and clothes to look like Beth, you may even 
be able to copy the way she walks and talks, but when it comes to the really 
important things, you're as far from Beth as they come.

Phillip: Would you care to repeat that? What 
did I just hear you say?

Edmund: Beth and I were just talking about 
the terrible headaches she's been getting since the accident. They make her so 
withdrawn; she's almost a completely different person, barely recognizable.
Phillip: Do you have a headache right now?
Lorelei: Just a teeny one.

Phillip: Well, that's funny; you certainly 
seemed fine at dinner.

Edmund: Oh, they come out of nowhere and 
vanish just as quickly. As a matter of fact, you had a bit of a memory lapse 
earlier, didn't you?

Lorelei: Yes. For a moment, I forgot your 
name.
Phillip: If only.

Lorelei: You know, before this headache gets 
any worse, I should really take one of my pills. Would you get them for me, 
Edmund?

Edmund: They're very strong, darling. The 
doctor said you shouldn't take them unless absolutely necessary.

Lorelei: Well, I know, but I just want them 
with me just in case. They're upstairs on my nightstand.
Edmund: Of course.

Lorelei: And while you're going, could you 
fix me a roast beef sandwich?

Edmund: Are you sure you're still hungry, 
Beth? You just had dinner.

Lorelei: Well, I’m supposed to take the 
medication with food, remember?
Edmund: Quite right.

Lorelei: Russian dressing on the roast beef 
would be great.

Phillip: I thought you hated Russian 
dressing?

Lorelei: Well, that's really kind of a funny 
thing because, well, what happened was when I was in the hospital in Mexico, one 
of the nurses put Russian dressing on everything, and I just developed a taste 
for it.

Phillip: You want to put a little Russian 
dressing on that, Edmund? Wow.
Lorelei: Wow?

Phillip: Wow. It's good to have you here. 
Home.

Lorelei: Yeah? Well, it is... It's really 
good to be home... With you-- and the kids and mom, too.

Phillip: Right. Okay, well, I’m going to hit 
the hay. You enjoy that sandwich.

Lorelei: Well, you know, it's early yet. It's 
really early. We could play a game of five- card stud.
Phillip: Now you're playing poker?
Lorelei: I learned in the hospital.
Phillip: You learned-- from the missionaries?

Lorelei: Well, we had to do something to pass 
the time. You know. But if you don't want to play poker, we could play something 
more time like gin rummy or casino or go fish.

Phillip: No. No, I’d love to play some poker. 
That would be... A penny a point.
Lorelei: Whatever floats your boat.

Phillip: Whatever floats my boat. Okay. 
You're kind of full of yourself tonight. I’m not... I’m not... I’m not sure 
exactly what it is that's gotten into you, but I think I kind of like it.
Lorelei: Yeah?
Phillip: Yeah.
Lorelei: Cut the deck.
Tony: Hey.
Catalina: Hey.
Tony: What are you doing here?
Catalina: I don't know.
Tony: Catalina?

Catalina: I wanted to help clean... That's 
not true. I guess I just didn't want the night to end.

Tony: Yeah. Some night all right. You know 
you did an awesome job. You know that, right? I mean, everybody had a great...
Catalina: Sam and Marah broke up.

Tony: I don't know if they broke up, they had 
a fight...

Catalina: They're history, Tony. She's free. 
So if you want her back...
Tony: Why would I want her back?

Catalina: I don't know. She hurt you time and 
time again. She never appreciated you. But, if you want her, then now is your 
chance.

Tony: Catalina, I don't... I don't know why 
you're talking about this, but let's please not.

Catalina: You know, I wonder if Marah ever 
really knew you. Could she, when you two come from such different worlds? She 
doesn't know the fire in your soul, how brave and loyal you are... She doesn't 
know that the heart that beats here is generous and kind... That your eyes, they 
see so much. They understand so much. That you're so strong. That when you kiss, 
it's so tender.
Tony: Cat...
Catalina: She doesn't know, but I do.

Tony: I think you see more in me than what's 
there, all right? I’m not some hero, okay?
Catalina: Yes, you are. You're my hero.

Sam: Marah, think of all the things Tony's done for you, when his pride was 
supposedly so hurt that he didn't care about you anymore. He came down to San 
Cristobel after you, he saved your dad's career. He even invited you to his 
birthday party.
Marah: Stop.
Sam: Why don't you want to hear this?

Marah: Because even if he does care about me, 
there's no way he would let me back into his life.

Sam: You're never going to know that unless 
you try. You know that. Unless you think he loves Catalina now. Is that it? You 
think he's chosen her over you or something?

Marah: All I know is that I can't take any 
more rejection right now-- or heartache.
Sam: Join the club.
Marah: I’m so sorry.
Sam: So am I. Go to him. Marah, go find Tony.
Harley: Have you ever seen Rick look happier?

Buzz: I can't say as I have. How are you two 
doing, besides exhausted?
Harley: I asked Rick to marry me.
Buzz: Okay.

Harley: Well, he asked me when he first found 
out I was pregnant.
Buzz: Yeah, Frank told me.
Harley: And I said no.

Buzz: And now you've reconsidered. You don't 
love him.

Harley: Where has passion ever gotten me? 
Where has it ever gotten either one of us?
Buzz: But along the way...

Harley: No, no, no. Dad, dad, dad-- Rick and 
I are great friends; we'll be great partners and great parents, and that's what 
I want for Jude. I want that for all my kids. I want some stability. I just want 
some stability. Can you please be happy for me, please?

Buzz: I will, okay. I’ll be happy for you. If 
being married to Rick will make you happy, then who am I to say otherwise?
Harley: Oh, thank you.

Buzz: I’ll even cater it if you want. Are you 
sure?

Harley: Well, he hasn't officially said yes 
yet, so...
Buzz: He turned down my daughter?

Harley: No. No, he hasn't turned me down, but 
this is a big step, he wants to sleep on it. Not that we're actually sleeping.
Buzz: I can't do this.
Harley: Can't do what?

Buzz: Outside. We've got to get some air. 
Look, he's a great guy. He's a great guy, all right? But you don't love him.
Harley: Yes, I do.

Buzz: Not the way, you know, like you love 
somebody who wants you to marry them. Not the way I loved Jenna, not the way-- 
God help us-- you loved Phillip.

Harley: Oh, see, where did all that love get 
me?

Buzz: Oh, come on. I mean, you're 
rationalizing into doing something wrong.

Harley: I’m not rationalizing. I am trying to 
make a good choice here, dad. I’m trying to use my heart and my head.
Buzz: Is this what he wants?
Harley: He asked me first.
Buzz: But now he wants to think about it.
Harley: Well, it's a big step.

Buzz: Yeah, absolutely, it's a big step, so 
why don't you... Don't rush into it. Think about it for a few weeks.

Harley: Please, can't you just support me? Do 
you have to do this?

Buzz: I am supporting you. I love you, I 
adore you, I want to see you be happy. I don't want you to sell yourself short, 
you know? I mean, you need romance, you know, passion. You think you can live 
without those things, but you can't, because you know that's just... It's not 
living. Come on inside.
Harley: I’ll be in a minute.

Gus: You know, for once in his life, I think 
your father's right.

Harley: Not again. The place is closed for 
family.

Gus: I’m family. I’m family... At least an 
honorary uncle or something, right? Hey, hey, hey, pally. How's Trix?

Harley: Don't breathe on him; we're trying to 
get him to sleep.

Gus: Yeah, well, no wonder he can't sleep. He 
senses all of the tension in the room. May I?

Harley: You know, I’ve actually had 
experience.

Gus: Yeah, well, so have I. I brought the kid 
into the world, you know? Hey. Hey. Ah, yeah, I think he recognizes me. Can I? 
May I? Thanks. Hey there, buddy. Don't cry. Oh, don't start. (Baby cries) my 
turn. That's all right. There you go. There you go. You've had a stressful day, 
I know. I know it's been a hard day, it's tough. It's tough being born, 
actually, isn't it? It's very intense. A little bedtime story, maybe? A little 
bedtime story, or maybe, or actually more of a poem-- something my father used 
to tell me. You ready? You ready? "There was an ease to Casey’s manner as he 
stepped into his place. There was a pride in Casey’s bearing and a smile on 
Casey’s face. And when responding to the cheers, he lightly doffed his hat. No 
stranger in that crowd could doubt that Casey was at bat..."
Harley: Rick.

Rick: I just want my kid back. I want my son 
back.

Gus: Just be careful, he's sleeping. Didn't 
mean to steal your thunder.
Lorelei: (Laughs)

Phillip: Another full house? How did these 
missionaries teach you? Give me these cards. It's my deal. Ridiculous.

Lorelei: You know, Phillip, before we went 
out to dinner, you mentioned something about my inheritance.
Phillip: Yeah, what about it?

Lorelei: Well, that conversation we were 
having about Lizzie just made me start thinking about future generations and 
passing things down, so I’m just wondering: What's the status of all that?

Phillip: Are you talking about what you got 
from Bradley? Is that what you're talking about?
Lorelei: What?

Phillip: I’m not sure I understand why you're 
asking me this. Edmund was not able to steal it from you down in Mexico, if 
that's what you mean. That's not what you mean. What do you mean?

Lorelei: Well, Phillip, you know that I rely 
on your judgment in these matters.

Phillip: Well, I think you ought to dump him. 
Oh, you mean the bequest.

Lorelei: Are there papers that I need to sign 
or file to claim what's mine?

Phillip: I thought you said you didn't want 
it. That's what you said before you left. I mean, besides, given the source, I 
think we both know what it's probably worth.

Lorelei: How much? I mean, I can't remember 
things and I have these silly blackouts, so I need you to tell me things.

Edmund: Beth! Brought your pills. But it 
looks as if you don't need them. Apparently, your headache seems to have 
vanished.
Catalina: Don't you want me?

Tony: You have to ask? I just... I just don't 
want to take advantage of you.

Catalina: Yeah, well, maybe I’m the one 
taking advantage of you.

Tony: Oh, I can live with that. But I can 
also take you back to your dorm.

Catalina: Tony, why would you want to do 
that?

Tony: Because I don't want to hurt you. I 
care too much about you.

Catalina: Tony, you are the one that's 
hurting tonight. I’m just trying to make it feel better. How am I doing? Let's 
go upstairs.
Tony: Cat...

Lorelei: I didn't realize it until you said something, but you're right. My 
headache went away.

Edmund: Oh, marvelous. Then you won't be 
needing these. Or this. Playing poker?

Phillip: Yeah. Yeah. As a matter of fact, we 
were. It was... It was a lot of fun, very enlightening. But I have to say 
goodnight. Got to go through a few files before I hit the hay. Going to see 
Lizzie off to school in the morning?
Lorelei: Try and stop me.

Edmund: Good. Then we can head off house 
hunting afterward.

Phillip: What? So soon? I thought that you 
were going to stick around for a few days and take it easy.
Lorelei: I think...

Edmund: Well, I think the sooner we find our 
own place, the sooner we'll be out of your hair, Phillip.

Phillip: Well, don't worry about that, 
Edmund. Although if you're uncomfortable here, please feel free to go back to 
Towers.

Edmund: Well, then I think we should both go. 
Beth?

Phillip: Well, I think Beth is staying to try 
to make it easier for Lizzie. Yeah?

Lorelei: Exactly. That's what we both want. 
Lizzie's feelings have to come first right now, sweetie.

Edmund: But of course. I just thought it 
would make you more comfortable.

Phillip: Oh, no. I’m very comfortable. I’ll 
say good night. Excuse me.
Lorelei: Good night.
Edmund: Smug, supercilious...
Lorelei: Suave, good-looking, loaded.
Edmund: What am I? Pate?
Lorelei: Well, you ain't loaded. Sorry-- not.

Edmund: You realize he was only trying to 
keep you around here, so he can trip you up. He's suspicious.
Lorelei: He is not.

Edmund: What did the two of you talk about 
while I was gone?

Lorelei: You're the one he wants to leave, 
Eddie-- not me. He's crazy about me.

Edmund: Yes, and you seem to be returning the 
sentiment. Well, I think it's time you start behaving like my wife, and I think 
it's time that Phillip finds out just how much we adore each other.
Rick: Do we have everything we came with?

Harley: Yeah. Gosh, I am so tired, I can 
barely stand.

Rick: Hey, just take your time. I’ll bring 
everything to the car, okay?

Harley: No. You know, Rick, I told my father 
what I asked you, and he said that if you don't say yes, you're a fool. See? I 
am in high demand. I am quite a catch-- or, at least, my father thinks so.

Rick: Well, you are a catch, but it's... You 
know what? I’m not saying no, it's just a... It's just a very big step and I 
want to make sure, that's all.
Harley: I am sure.

Gus: Hey. Sorry. You know, your father 
refused to serve me a cup of coffee. I think I’m going to have to sue him for 
discrimination.

Harley: I’ll be right there. Give me a 
second.
Rick: Yeah, sure.
Gus: Marriage?
Harley: You were
Rick: Yeah, sure.
Gus: Marriage?
Harley: You were eavesdropping again?

Gus: You know, if you want to have a private 
conversation, you should probably have it in private. Wow. That was quick. You 
love him?
Harley: I... This is not your business.
Gus: Right, right.

Harley: Rick and I, we... We share a child 
together.

Gus: We share a bond together, you know, I 
helped bring that kid into the world.
Harley: No, Rick and I, we share a bond.
Gus: So do we, we share a bond.
Harley: You are impossible, forget it.

Gus: No, listen to me, you forget it, okay? 
You just forget about him. I am what you need, and if you were just halfway 
honest with yourself, you would realize that. Do you hear me? Turn around, Coop. 
If you want me, just, you'll turn around.
Marah: Tony?
Catalina: Tony...
Marah: He must be in bed already.
